title: Søren D. Petersen
text:
Teemi is an open-source Python platform for literate, data-driven engineering of biosystems, supporting simulation, structured data capture, and AI-assisted design under FAIR principles. I led its conceptualization and development to streamline the DBTL cycle, enabling scalable, automated, and hypothesis-driven experimentation in synthetic biology. See reference below:
[1] S. D. Petersen, L. Levassor, C. M. Pedersen, et al. “Teemi: An Open-Source Literate Programming Approach for Iterative Design-Build-Test-Learn Cycles in Bioengineering”. In: PLOS Computational Biology 20.3 (Mar. 2024), p. e1011929. ISSN: 1553-7358. DOI: 10.1371/journal.pcbi.1011929. https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1011929 (visited on 10/28/2024).

title: Søren D. Petersen
text:
Below, you can try a yield predictor model similar to the glm model used in the publication:
[1] C. T. Petersen, M. K. Langgaard, and S. D. Petersen. “Yield Prediction in Spring Barley from Spectral Reflectance and Weather Data Using Machine Learning”. In: Soil Use and Management* 39.2 (2023), pp. 975-987. ISSN: 1475-2743. DOI: 10.1111/sum.12902. https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/sum.12902 (visited on 10/28/2024).*

title: Søren D. Petersen
text:
I hold a PhD in Microbiology and have, in parallel, specialized in data science. I believe this combination offers significant untapped potential—both scientifically and commercially.
I have primarily created this website to learn technical details about the process. But you can also read my CV and see a few examples of digital tools I have developed.





Søren D. Petersen
